summary: On Tuesday, Jim Cramer, host of Mad Money, broke down the day's market movements as he pointed to rising bond yields as the main force behind a series of notable shifts in stock performance . We recently published a list ofJim Cramer Talked About These 10 Stocks Recently . In this article, we are going to take a look at where Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) stands against other stocks that Cramer discussed recently .  Cramer discussed 10 stocks discussed by Jim Cramer during the episodes of Mad Money aired on May 20 . Insider Monkey compiled a list of 10 stocks that were discussed by Cramer . We also provided hedge fund sentiment for each stock as of the fourth quarter of 2024, which was taken from Insider Monkey’s database .  Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) designs, builds, and sells electric cars and energy products . The company provides vehicle sales, financing plans, solar systems, energy storage, and other related services to a wide range of customers . Overall, TSLAranks 2ndon our list of stocks that Jim Cramer discussed recently .

Tesla (TSLA) often comes to mind of electric vehicles, with BYD Co. (BYDDF) emerging as a significant global competitor . I believe the market continues to undervalue Tesla’s strategic advantages . I am prepared to navigate market fluctuations with the expectation of strong returns beginning in late 2026 and continuing into 2027 . If Tesla realizes its goals in autonomous technology, I believe its stock could surpass previous record highs .  Tesla delivered 336,681 units, with revenues of around $19.3 billion and net income of $409 million . While Tesla’s gross margin at 16.3% was weaker than that of BYD's . In 2024, it sold nearly 4.27 million vehicles worldwide, reflecting an impressive 41% year-over-year growth .  Tesla’s long-term strategic emphasis on artificial intelligence provides it with a significant competitive advantage . Tesla's Full Self-Driving product remains a substantial potential revenue stream, currently priced at $8,000 upfront or $99 per month . But BYD has real-world problems. It has very little presence in North America and Europe's premium markets .  Tesla represents a high-risk, high-reward opportunity centered on software-driven AI autonomy . Autonomous taxi networks and AI-powered subscription services may significantly enhance Tesla’s margins .  Trump’s tariffs on Chinese-made electric cars effectively prevent BYD from selling into the U.S. market due to prohibitively expensive import costs . Tesla will benefit most from such protectionism . Lax automotive and autonomy regulations brought in by Trump will also speed up growth . Tesla's valuation multiples remain relatively high, reflecting investors’ belief in breathtaking growth .  On Wall Street, Tesla has a Hold consensus rating based on 16 Buys, 10 Holds, and 11 Sell ratings . The average TSLA stock price target of $277.78 indicates 19% downside over the next 12 months . Tesla’s enormous cash reserves of $37 billion provide a financial buffer and room for continued aggressive investment in future technologies .  For investors aiming to gain exposure to the emerging era of intelligent mobility, Tesla represents a compelling portfolio position . It is well-positioned to capitalize on AI’s transformative impact on the global transportation market .

Tesla stock continues to trend downward amid declining sales and consumer backlash . SpaceX, Musk’s space exploration and technology startup, is also dealing with problems . SpaceX has attempted multiple rocket launches that haven’t gone well this year .  SpaceX is preparing to launch its Starship 9 rocket over the Caribbean, specifically over several British territories . The company has launched multiple Starship rockets this year, a central component of its plan to help colonize Mars . This comes at a time when SpaceX had seemed poised to usher in a new era of space tourism .  The British Virgin Islands, Turks and Caicos, and Anguilla are a group that includes the British Virgin islands . This has prompted concern among UK regulators that the people of these islands could be in danger if the SpaceX launch proceeds as planned . SpaceX has made the same claim, stating that it is “capable of carrying up to 150 metric tonnes fully reusable”  British regulators have asked the U.S. Department of State to consider having the launch trajectory or site changed to prevent further risks to British territories . They have also requested that more information regarding SpaceX’s planned safety measures be provided before the launch of Starship 9, expected to happen next week .  NASA says it's confident that more missions won’t mean more disasters post-launch . The agency says it’s confident that the launch of the Mars Mars spacecraft will not cause more disasters .

Tesla, Inc.’s (NASDAQ:TSLA) has started accepting Cyber Truck trade-ins for the first time . The low trade-in value reflects a glut in supply, with inventory levels reaching record highs of 10,000 units . Tesla CEO's remarks come at a time when Tesla needs a boost .  Tesla's underperformance comes amid growing consumer concerns about Musk’s political inclination . Consumer concerns have since spilled over, triggering reduced sales, exacerbated by owners returning or selling their vehicles to distance themselves from the brand . The stock is down by about 9% for the year .

Elon Musk revealed thatTesla (TSLA)is going to begin deploying self-driving taxi cabs to the streets of the US . Bartosiak looks at the inner workings of Tesla’s chart and tries to figure out where the next moves might run into trouble .  Dave Bartosiak's technical analysis approach adds depth to our understanding Tesla’s stock chart . He discusses chart patterns like head and shoulders, cup and handle, or flags, and their relevance in predicting future price movements . He emphasizes the importance of volume analysis in confirming price trends .  Technical analysis is a valuable tool, but it's important to consider other factors like fundamental analysis and market sentiment before making investment choices . Tesla, Inc. is one of the fastest-growing companies in the stock market, according to Zacks .

Bernstein told investors not to be misled by strong second-quarter results in the U.S. auto sector . The firm said that Q2 strength is a “mirage,” driven by tariff-related demand pull-forward . As consumers rushed to buy before tariffs took effect, automakers are now expected to face weaker demand in the months ahead .  Bernstein sees further downside ahead: “The downgrade cycle isn’t over, estimates for H2 and 2026 still too high” The firm expects investor optimism to fade as summer data confirms softer sell-through and rising discounts . Battery electric vehicles are being hit hardest, with average planned production down 17.5% per quarter .  Advantage audits are the best way to avoid audits in the U.S. audit world . Advantage audits can be used in audits of audits and audits of audit documents .

Investors should buy Tesla Inc (TSLA) stock and own it over the long term because of the strength of TSLA's operating system . Brian Belski is the Chief Investment Strategist of BMO Capital, an investment bank . However, the investor added that he was "underweight" the entire Mag 7 including Tesla .  Insider Monkey believes AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns . There is an AI stock that went up since the beginning of 2025, while popular AI stocks lost around 25% . If you are looking for a AI stock more promising than TSLA, check out our report about thischeapest AI stock .

Elon Musk thinks Tesla's Optimus robot will be the “biggest product of all time” now that it can learn new tasks from human instruction . “I think it will be 10 times bigger than the next biggest product ever made, like that level”  Elon Musk says he expects to have Optimus robots working in Tesla’s factory by the end of the year . Musk predicts demand for the robots “will be insatiable”

Tesla CFO Vaibhav Taneja sold another $1 million in common stock, marking his third sale to date in May . The electric vehicle maker’s finance chief has sold about $3 million in shares this month, according to filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission .  Tesla CFO was the only named Tesla executive to receive an equity award for 2024 . CFO's steady sales of company stock also come as the EV maker has seen its share value whipsaw over the past year in the face of economic and consumer pressure .  Tesla’s board reportedly fired what Wedbush Securities analyst Dan Ivestermed as a “warning shot”at Musk . The move comes after Tesla reported a 71% decline in net profit in its most recent quarter . Musk previously assured investors that he would be stepping back from his role at the Department of Government Efficiency .  Chipotle executive Jack Hartung will join Tesla's board of directors . CEO Elon Musk has reiterated a June 2025 launch date for the robot taxi service .  Hartung will officially step down from his executive roles effective June 1 . He will remain as a strategic advisorto ensure an orderly transition . Hartung currently serves on the board of Portillo's, The Honest Company, and Zocdoc .

Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights Nvidia NVDA, SoftBank Group SFTBY, the Global X Robotics & AI ETF BOTZ and Tesla TSLA . Nvidia unveiled its latest breakthrough: GR00T N1, the "World's First Open Humanoid Robot Foundation"  The global humanoid robot market is projected to surge from $2.4 billion measured in 2023 to nearly $114 billion by 2033 . This explosive growth is expected to be fueled by rising demand in healthcare, caregiving, and industrial automation . While wheeled robots currently dominate the market, the biped segment, which more closely mimics human movement, is the fastest-growing category .  Tesla is making waves with its Optimus robot, designed to perform repetitive or dangerous tasks . CEO Elon Musk envisions a future where humanoid robots will eventually surpass Tesla's car business in value . Nvidia, the undisputed leader in AI chips, just unveiled its new GR00T platform .  The GR00T chip is designed to help robots learn from human behavior and generalize tasks across environments . Nvidia's chips are already the backbone of AI and robotics innovation . SoftBank Grouphas has been investing in robotics for over a decade and owns Boston Dynamics and SoftBank Robotics .  While humanoid robotics may still seem futuristic to some, the pace of innovation and investment suggests the future is arriving sooner than expected . With major players like Nvidia, Tesla, and SoftBank already staking their claims, the groundwork is being laid for significant long-term upside .  This material is being provided for informational purposes only and nothing herein constitutes investment, legal, accounting or tax advice, or a recommendation to buy, sell or hold a security . Past performance is no guarantee of future results .  These returns are from hypothetical portfolios consisting of stocks with Zacks Rank = 1 that were rebalanced monthly with zero transaction costs . These are not the returns of actual portfolios of stocks . The S&P 500 is an unmanaged index .

The market for 800V electrified powertrain systems in electric vehicles is expected to experience significant growth from 2024 to 2035 . Asia-Pacific region is anticipated to lead this market, supported by strong EV manufacturing capabilities .  BYD ended the day at HK$462.60 up 4%, near its 52-week high . Tesla ended the . day at $343.82 up 0.5% . Ford Motorended the day . down 0.3% . Click through to explore the in-depth narrative on Lucid's growth strategy . xAI has already deployed 200,000 GPUs at its Memphis-based Colossus facility . Elon Musk said it is the most powerful training cluster in the world right now . xAI received priority GPU shipments over Tesla in 2024, Musk said .  A potential merger between Tesla and xAI is not on the table for now but not out of the question, Musk said . xAI spent $191 million in 2024 and another $36.8 million through February 2025 on Tesla Megapacks for energy storage .

TheTeslaCEO asserts he’s seeing a major rebound in customer interest for his EVs despite persistent evidence to the contrary . “The stock wouldn't be trading near all-time highs if things weren’t in good shape,” he said . Weeks after Tesla reported deliveries tumbled 13% in the first quarter, Musk claimed volumes have “already turned around”  Tesla stock is expected to open up Wednesday at around $345 a share . Analysts have noted the stock’s valuation multiple of 120x consensus 2026 earnings is first and foremost an expression of confidence in its AI and robotics plans, rather than its shrinking car business .  In January, the company quietly dropped the goal entirely, anticipating only a “return to growth” Musk repeated his claims in a separate interview with CNBC’s Faber on Tuesday: “We’ve seen a major rebound in demand at this point” Barring the launch of any surprise new models, evidence suggests Musk could be mistaken .  Tesla is on track to sell anywhere between 350,000 to 395,000 vehicles in Q2, another sharp decline from the 444,000 delivered last year . This disparity between rising EV sales and drops in Tesla's suggests Tesla has a problem with demand because of Musk's political activism .

GM will no longer ship vehicles from the United States to China . GM had been exporting vehicles to China through its premium import brand, The Durant Guild . This decision comes amid ongoing trade and tariff negotiations between the U.S. and China .  GM plans to expand its portfolio further in 2025 by introducing extended-range electric vehicles . New energy vehicles (NEVs) jumped 53.2% compared to the same period last year . GM carries a Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell) at present .  Last month,Tesla, Inc. halted new orders for its Model S and Model X on its Chinese website . Rising competition from BYD and other domestic manufacturers has also hurt Tesla's sales in China .

TheTesla Inc. CEO, who was frequently mentioned by President Donald Trump and his administration, has not been referenced in over a month . The frequency of Musk’s mentions in Trump's speeches, social media posts, White House briefings and fundraising emails has seen a significant drop . The White House, when questioned about this change, did not directly address Musk's absence .  POLITICO's analysis suggests that Musk’s reduced visibility may benefit the GOP politically . Republicans still view Musk favorably and anticipate his support in upcoming elections . Democrats are capitalizing on Musk's declining popularity in key electoral contests .  Elon Musk stepped down from his role leading the DOGE to focus more on Tesla . Musk stated he would be "allocating far more” of his time to Tesla from May . Tesla suffered a 71% decline in profits in the first quarter .  $1,000 you can invest at just $0.30/share! Inspired by Uber and Airbnb – Deloitte's fastest-growing software company is transforming 7 billion smartphones into income-generating assets .

Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA)’s CEO, Elon Musk, confirmed in an interview with CNBC that the company is on schedule to launch robotaxi trials in Austin, Texas, by the end of June . The EV maker will begin the trials with 10 self-driving cars in safer parts of Austin with geofencing and deploy up to a thousand robotaxis within a few months .  Tesla CEO Elon Musk committed to staying as Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA)’s CEO for the next five years . He is likely to further alleviate investor concerns about his commitment to the company . While we acknowledge the potential of TSLA as an investment, we believe some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns .

Elon Musk confirmed Tuesday that he plans to stay put at Tesla . Last month, Tesla reported its worst quarter for sales in three years . Tesla’s decline of 13% so far this year is the worst performance in the Magnificent Seven aside from Apple .  The multi-hyphenate CEO has been accused of letting his political advocacy get in the way of his business duties . "I’m going to do a lot less in the future," Musk said in an interview at the Qatar Economic Forum .  Tesla is struggling to maneuver in a world it helped bring about . The next big bet on Tesla's future lies with the company’s autonomous hopes of supplying a fleet of robotaxis to redefine transportation .  It's debatable whether producing a driverless, on-demand taxi service has the same moral gravity or commercial urgency as Tesla's earlier climate-healing aspirations . The question is whether Tesla's next phase can muster the same kind of support .  Click here for the latest stock market news and in-depth analysis . Read the latest financial and business news from Yahoo Finance . Watch Yahoo Finance on Facebook and Twitter .

Amazon beat Wall Street's earnings estimates in the past six quarters . Tesla has lost substantial market share in electric cars across the U.S., Europe, and China . Amazon has a strong presence in e-commerce, digital advertising, and cloud computing .  Philippe Laffont of Coatue Management bought 83,599 shares of Amazon, increasing his stake by 1% . He also sold 531,754 shares of Tesla, trimming his stake 24% . Most Wall Street analysts still think investors should buy Amazon and avoid Tesla .  The investment thesis for Amazon is simple: The company has a strong presence in three growing industries . Wall Street expected operating income of $17.6 billion, which implies growth between negative 11% to positive 19% . Amazon Web Services is the market leader in cloud computing .  Wall Street estimates Amazon's earnings will increase at 10% annually through 2026 . Amazon beat the consensus estimate by 21% in the last six quarters . Tesla has seen a substantial decrease in demand across its three major geographies .  Tesla has significant opportunity in self-driving cars and robots . The company will launch its first autonomous ride-sharing service in Austin, Texas, in June . Tesla is building autonomous humanoid robots to tap what Musk believes will be a $10 trillion opportunity .  Wall Street anticipates Tesla's earnings will increase at 14% annually through 2026 . That makes the current valuation of 150 times earnings look absurdly expensive . But patient investors with conviction in Musk's vision should hold the stock .  If you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009, you’d have $351,127! Nvidia:if you invested  in Nvidia, you could have $642,582! Netflix: If you invest in Apple in 2008, you'd have $40,106! Netflix is also on the market now .  Tesla Stock vs. Amazon Stock: Billionaires Buy One and Sell the Other . Tesla stock vs. Tesla stock: Billionaire buy one and sell the other .

The company reported a 9% decline in first-quarter revenue to $19.3 billion, missing analyst estimates by $2 billion . Europe, while only a small percentage of sales, was a challenging region in the quarter . However, through it all, investors have bid up Tesla shares by more than 40% since that disastrous earnings .  Tesla CEO Elon Musk returns to his day job at Tesla full time, leaving behind his political ambitions for the time being . As an unapproved, unofficial cabinet member, Musk is legally only allowed to serve for up to 130 days in his position at the Department of Government Efficiency, or DOGE .  Tesla shares have jumped more than 50% since opening trading on April 23, the day after its earnings . Musk: "Clearly, the market is aware of the situation. So it's already turned around"  Despite the rough quarter, Tesla investors got the news they'd been waiting all year for: Elon Muskis leaving his post in Washington, D.C., to spend more time at his day job in Austin running Tesla . For most investors, that is all that matters .

Waymo, the autonomous ride-hailing business owned by Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL), accomplished 10 million paid robotaxi trips, co-CEO Tekedra Mawakana revealed at the Google I/O developer conference on Tuesday, May 20, 2025 . The significant achievement doubles the total number of trips in just five months .  Waymo prioritizes safety over rival Tesla's planned robotaxi launch . Tesla aims to quickly expand to San Francisco and Los Angeles if it is successful . Unlike Waymo, Tesla's system is reliant on cameras rather than lidar or radar .  Waymo has Secured Approval to expand its Driverless Ride-Hailing Service to San Jose . Waymo’s Waymo employees and employees will be able to pick up the ride-hailing service in San Jose, California .

Elon Musk expects Tesla and xAI to continue buying chips from Nvidia and AMD . Musk said xAI is planning to build a facility near Memphis that will house 1 million GPUs . Meanwhile, Tesla requires “quite a few” GPUs to train its Optimus humanoid robots .  Shares of Tesla, AMD, and Nvidia were little-changed in after-hours trading . Tesla eked out a 0.5% gain during Tuesday's regular session, while AMD and Nvidia lost about 1%. Nvidia, which saw its shares surge over the past week afterannouncing a major dealto supply chips to Saudi AI startup Humain, is due to report earnings next week .

Tesla trades at a price-to-earnings ratio of 181.98x, well above most growth stocks . The stock is up more than 95% over the past 12 months but has declined 15% so far in 2025 . Morgan Stanley's Adam Jonas maintains a Buy rating with a $410 price target .  The energy storage segment alone is worth $67 per share, excluding future recurring revenues . The autonomous Cybercab service is expected to launch in Austin next month with 10 to 20 vehicles . The Optimus robot, if it replaces just 1% of global human labor, could add over $300 billion in value .

Elon Musk said he plans to stay on as Tesla CEO for at least the next five years . Wedbush's Dan Ives, a longtime Tesla bull, said he sees "a different Musk" compared to the last few months .  Wedbush analyst Dan Ives says he sees "a different Musk than we saw over the last one, three months" in watching the CEO's interviews . Musk looks to have a "dedicated focus on Tesla, driving the next initiative" of autonomous vehicles, he says .  Tesla shares ended the day up just 0.5% after rising earlier in the session . They are still down roughly 15% since the start of the year . Musk said he planned to return tospending more of his time at Tesla starting this month .

Elon Musk says he is committed to staying on as Tesla CEO for at least another five years . Tesla shares rose as much as 3.3% on the comments before settling to a 1% gain . The stock is down 15% so far in 2025 .  Starlink currently operates in more than 70 countries, with a push into emerging markets such as India . Musk said U.S. regulation is needed but warned against overregulation .

Tesla is on track to sell anywhere between 350,000 to 395,000 vehicles in Q2, another sharp decline from the 444,000 delivered last year . This disparity between rising EV sales and drops in Tesla's suggests Tesla has a problem with demand because of Musk's political activism .

GM will no longer ship vehicles from the United States to China . GM had been exporting vehicles to China through its premium import brand, The Durant Guild . This decision comes amid ongoing trade and tariff negotiations between the U.S. and China .  GM plans to expand its portfolio further in 2025 by introducing extended-range electric vehicles . New energy vehicles (NEVs) jumped 53.2% compared to the same period last year . GM carries a Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell) at present .  Last month,Tesla, Inc. halted new orders for its Model S and Model X on its Chinese website . Rising competition from BYD and other domestic manufacturers has also hurt Tesla's sales in China .

Elon Musk confirmed Tuesday that he plans to stay put at Tesla . Last month, Tesla reported its worst quarter for sales in three years . Tesla’s decline of 13% so far this year is the worst performance in the Magnificent Seven aside from Apple . "I’m going to do a lot less in the future," Musk said in an interview at the Qatar Economic Forum .  Tesla is struggling to maneuver in a world it helped bring about . The next big bet on Tesla's future lies with the company’s autonomous hopes of supplying a fleet of robotaxis to redefine transportation . Amazon beat Wall Street's earnings estimates in the past six quarters . Tesla has lost substantial market share in electric cars across the U.S., Europe, and China . Amazon has a strong presence in e-commerce, digital advertising, and cloud computing .  Philippe Laffont of Coatue Management bought 83,599 shares of Amazon, increasing his stake by 1% . He also sold 531,754 shares of Tesla, trimming his stake 24% . Most Wall Street analysts still think investors should buy Amazon and avoid Tesla .  The investment thesis for Amazon is simple: The company has a strong presence in three growing industries . Wall Street expected operating income of $17.6 billion, which implies growth between negative 11% to positive 19% . Amazon Web Services is the market leader in cloud computing .  Wall Street estimates Amazon's earnings will increase at 10% annually through 2026 . Amazon beat the consensus estimate by 21% in the last six quarters . Tesla has seen a substantial decrease in demand across its three major geographies .  Tesla has significant opportunity in self-driving cars and robots . The company will launch its first autonomous ride-sharing service in Austin, Texas, in June . Tesla is building autonomous humanoid robots to tap what Musk believes will be a $10 trillion opportunity .  Wall Street anticipates Tesla's earnings will increase at 14% annually through 2026 . That makes the current valuation of 150 times earnings look absurdly expensive . But patient investors with conviction in Musk's vision should hold the stock . Tesla CEO Elon Musk returns to his day job at Tesla full time, leaving behind his political ambitions for the time being . As an unapproved, unofficial cabinet member, Musk is legally only allowed to serve for up to 130 days in his position at the Department of Government Efficiency, or DOGE .  Tesla shares have jumped more than 50% since opening trading on April 23, the day after its earnings . Musk: "Clearly, the market is aware of the situation. So it's already turned around"  Despite a rough quarter, Tesla investors got the news they'd been waiting all year for: Elon Musk is leaving his post in Washington, D.C., to spend more time at his day job in Austin running Tesla . For most investors, that is all that matters .

Waymo, the autonomous ride-hailing business owned by Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL), accomplished 10 million paid robotaxi trips, co-CEO Tekedra Mawakana revealed at the Google I/O developer conference on Tuesday, May 20, 2025 . Waymo’s Waymo employees and employees will be able to pick up the ride-hailing service in San Jose, California .
